title: How to learn to dance at the age of 23 - Quora

response.answer_text: I am smiling while writing the answer because I am not good dancer and never performed a single step in a stage .No worry I will do while I am writing the answer :) So the answer is It doesn't matter how much aged you are,all matters how much strong will power is .You love music and i can presume that you have a great collection of songs in your smartphone . If not then go to youtube and select a playlist of your favourite songs . Tips only here to choose romantic songs instead of sufi songs ,because they are enriched with great dancing steps :) Now dont think how your dancing steps are, instead focus on how much you in that .Day 1 : Learning from youtube. Actually its a better way because you can see the steps and on your pace you can play or pause the song. Some basics are from here:   There are many more songs online instructions on this but the idea behind learning is like : Play/pause songs until you didn't done that step.Perform it multiple times until you get autos zagging of body on any song.Dance on those songs which you love by heart,reports say that human mind do executions when it finds a suitable moment.Take water and insta energy as much as possible because body vains are started being stiffy after workout .Do by heart and do not gets demotivated if someone laughs on you. They are fools who laugh on others.Do it until you didn't perform a full dance step on a song .Day 30 : you are all set to rock any floor, so go to any random marriage ceremony and rock the dance floor. ;) ( do it on your risk or until you know how to attend a marriage without invitation)Dance is one of best way to show your skills in front of world ,lets do it with heart. :) PS: Once u learned , share a video with us so we can watch and eat popcorn like dino :) :)  Happy dancing :)

In the US there are lots of dance studios. I dated a guy that taught ballroom dancing. I found out I loved it. There are hip hop classes, salsa classes, pretty much anything you can think of. Even if you do not have a partner to bring, just let the instructor know. They can usually match you up with someone, if necessary. It’s also great exercise and it’s fun. It’s great to meet new people too. I think it’s easier to learn in a dance studio because everyone is at the same level. Whereas, if you go to a club, everyone is doing something different and it’s difficult for me to pick up a particular style.
